title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: At Lord Gillies's we found Sir John Dalrymple, Lady Dalrymple, and MissFerguson, Mr. Hope Vere of Craigiehall, and Lady Elizabeth, a sister ofLord Tweeddale, Sir Robert O'Callaghan, Captain Cathcart, and others--agay party.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: picturesque, as is also the scenery about the old bridge of Craigiehall.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: (4-^) Cross the Almond by Cramond Bridge, and pass on the left New Saughton (Lord Aberdour), and Craigiehall (Hope Vere, Esq.) On the shore is the vilhige of Cramond, and on the right the entrance to Dalmeny Park, the seat of the Earl of Rosebery.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: At Lord Gillies's we found Sir John Dalrymple, Lady Dalrymple, and Miss Ferguson, Mr. Hope Vere of Craigiehall,  and Lady Elizabeth, a sister of Lord Tweeddale, Sir Kobert O'Callaghan, Captain Cathcart, and others a gay party.
